text: Alexander Schalck-Golodkowski (July 3, 1932 – June 21, 2015) was a East German politician and trader. He was born in Berlin. He was director of a main department ('Hauptverwaltungsleiter') in the Ministry for Foreign Trade and German Domestic Trade (1956–62), the Deputy Minister for External Trade (1967–75), and head of the GDR's Kommerzielle Koordinierung (KoKo, 1966–86). He was also a Stasi colonel. ==Other websites== *Biography Category:1932 births Category:2015 deaths Category:German colonels Category:Politicians from Berlin Category:Politicians of the Socialist Unity Party of Germany Category:Stasi people
title: Alexander Schalck-Golodkowski
